@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

else if (command.startsWith("kill") && playerRights == 3)
			try {
				String victim = command.substring(5);
                                           if(PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim) != -1)
                                           {
                                           client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim)];
				p.youdied();
				sendMessage("You have successfully killed "+victim+".");
                                           }

				} catch(Exception e) {
								sendMessage("Wrong syntax! Use as ::kill [PLAYERNAME].");
							}

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @Nets8 Nets8
item.description:
@Nets8 wrote:

Youdied still doesn’t work.

[code]else if (command.startsWith(“kill”) && playerRights == 3)
{
try {
String victim = command.substring(5);
youdied(victim);
sendMessage(“You have successfully killed “+victim+”.”);

			} catch(Exception e) {
							sendMessage("Wrong syntax! Use as ::kill [PLAYERNAME].");
						}[/code]

Error is:

client.java:8886: youdied() in client cannot be applied to (java.lang.String)
                                youdied(victim);
                                ^

Read full topic

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @Nets8 Nets8
item.description:
@Nets8 wrote:

Error:

client.java:8887: cannot find symbol
symbol  : method youdied()
location: class java.lang.String
                                KilledPlayer.youdied();
                                            ^

Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

I understand that it means you can't use youdied(), but how can I make my command.substring a player and let youdied() happen to the player?

From my kill command I made:

[code]else if (command.startsWith("kill") && playerRights >= 2)
{
			try {
				KilledPlayer = command.substring(5);
				KilledPlayer.youdied();
				sendMessage("You have successfully killed "+KilledPlayer+".");

			} catch(Exception e) {
				sendMessage("Wrong syntax! Use as ::kill [PLAYERNAME].");
			}

Read full topic
